abstract: Bank of America named one of its top managers, Brian T. Moynihan, on Wednesday evening as its new chief executive, succeeding Kenneth D. Lewis, who plans to leave by the end of the year.
snippet: Bank of America named one of its top managers, Brian T. Moynihan, on Wednesday evening as its new chief executive, succeeding Kenneth D. Lewis, who plans to leave by the end of the year.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America named one of its top managers, Brian T. Moynihan, on Wednesday evening as its new chief executive, succeeding Kenneth D. Lewis, who plans to leave by the end of the year.

headline.main: New Chief at BofA; U.S. Delays Selling Citi Stake

abstract: Bank of America named one of its top managers, Brian Moynihan, as its chief executive, succeeding Kenneth D. Lewis, who plans to leave by the end of the year.
snippet: Bank of America named one of its top managers, Brian Moynihan, as its chief executive, succeeding Kenneth D. Lewis, who plans to leave by the end of the year.
lead_paragraph: Finally, there is white smoke at Bank of America: Brian T. Moynihan was selected to become the next chief executive.

headline.main: Bank Picks a Successor to Lewis
headline.print_headline: Bank Picks A Successor To Lewis

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Louise Story

abstract: One of the top internal contenders for Bank of America’s chief executive spot had become the object of heightened scrutiny from the New York attorney general’s office over what he knew about the firm’s deal for Merrill Lynch, possibly eliminating him from consideration.
snippet: One of the top internal contenders for Bank of America’s chief executive spot had become the object of heightened scrutiny from the New York attorney general’s office over what he knew about the firm’s deal for Merrill Lynch, possibly eliminating ...
lead_paragraph: Bank of America late on Wednesday finally picked Brian T. Moynihan as its next chief executive, resolving questions about who would succeed Kenneth D. Lewis as the head of America’s largest bank by assets.

headline.main: N.Y. Attorney General Questioned BofA Exec’s Testimony

abstract: It was a regular love fest at Bank of America on Thursday as Brian T. Moynihan, the incoming chief executive, traded compliments with his predecessor, Kenneth D. Lewis.
snippet: It was a regular love fest at Bank of America on Thursday as Brian T. Moynihan, the incoming chief executive, traded compliments with his predecessor, Kenneth D. Lewis.
lead_paragraph: It was a regular love fest at Bank of America on Thursday as Brian T. Moynihan, the incoming chief executive, traded compliments with his predecessor, Kenneth D. Lewis.

headline.main: At Bank of America, the Brian and Ken Show

abstract: At least twice over the past year or so — and especially this week — Citigroup’s best-laid plans have been derailed by Wells Fargo, its scrappier West Coast rival.
snippet: At least twice over the past year or so — and especially this week — Citigroup’s best-laid plans have been derailed by Wells Fargo, its scrappier West Coast rival.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup has traditionally seen Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase as its main rivals, competing fiercely with the other two giant universal banks across a broad spectrum of businesses.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
